?yvind, 
I can't reproduce this. It works fine even if the frame doesn't have a function 
or file name. The "disassemble" command gets called for the address range.
In your case it is called for the wrong file name:

[1,100,699,119,328] 14-data-disassemble -f C:\\eclipse3\\. -l 0 -n 100 -- 1
[1,100,699,119,328] &"mi_cmd_disassemble: Invalid filename.\n"
[1,100,699,119,328] 14^error,msg="mi_cmd_disassemble: Invalid filename."
[1,100,699,119,328] (gdb) 

This causes the NullPointerException in the platform. I have submitted a bug 
for this exception (https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=79331). But 
the problem is how the debugger retrieves the invalid file name.
Can you please debug it?
?yvind, please provide the build id of the Eclipse version you are using.

Mea culpa 

The filename problem in disassembly was a bug in my CygWin -> Host filename
translation. I really want to get rid of those hacks, but alas I have no
alternative for the moment. My CDT hacks accidentally translated an empty
filename for the stackframe to "c:\eclipse\.".

Disassembly now works fine.

There are some remaining issues that I need to follow up on in this PR, but I
think it is more approperiate to open a new PR if anything turns up.


?yvind
I'm unable to reproduce or explain this exception, though I see it from time to
another. 

I'm not aware of any visible problems in the CDT GUI that goes along with the
exception.

?yvind
